intro: Fagelia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima holly, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, providing a striking visual contrast to its delicate blossoms. Fagelia tolimensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
